Level 2: SDG1.1 Eradicate extreme poverty everywhere.
SDG1.2 Reduce by half the proportion of people living in poverty in all dimensions.
SDG1.3 Implement universal social protection systems for the poor and vulnerable.
SDG1.4 Ensure equal access to resources, services, property, and finance for all.
SDG1.5 Strengthen resilience of the poor and vulnerable to climate, economic, and social shocks.
SDG1.a Mobilize resources and cooperation to support poverty eradication in developing countries.
SDG1.b Build inclusive, gender-sensitive policy frameworks that promote investment in poverty eradication.
SDG2.1 End hunger and ensure year-round access to safe, nutritious, and sufficient food for all.
SDG2.2 End all forms of malnutrition and meet global targets on child stunting, wasting, and nutrition for women and older people.
SDG2.3 Double productivity and incomes of small-scale food producers through fair access to land, finance, and markets.
SDG2.4 Ensure sustainable and resilient food production that protects ecosystems and improves soil and land quality.
SDG2.5 Preserve genetic diversity in agriculture and ensure fair benefit sharing.
SDG2.a Increase investment in rural infrastructure, agricultural research, and technology, especially in developing countries.
SDG2.b Eliminate trade distortions and export subsidies in agriculture to create fair global markets.
SDG2.c Improve transparency and access to food market information to reduce extreme price volatility.
SDG3.1 Reduce the global maternal mortality ratio to below 70 per 100,000 live births.
SDG3.2 End preventable deaths of newborns and children under 5 years of age.
SDG3.3 End major epidemics and combat hepatitis and other infectious diseases.
SDG3.4 Reduce premature deaths from non-communicable diseases by one third and promote mental health and well-being.
SDG3.5 Prevent and treat substance abuse, including drug and alcohol misuse.
SDG3.6 Halve global deaths and injuries from road traffic accidents.
SDG3.7 Ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health services and education.
SDG3.8 Achieve universal health coverage, including affordable access to medicines and vaccines.
SDG3.9 Reduce deaths and illnesses from hazardous chemicals and pollution of air, water, and soil.
SDG3.a Implement the WHO Framework Convention on Tobacco Control.
SDG3.b Support R&D and equitable access to affordable medicines and vaccines for all.
SDG3.c Increase health financing and strengthen the health workforce in developing countries.
SDG3.d Build capacity for early warning and management of national and global health risks.
SDG4.1 Ensure all girls and boys complete free, equitable, and quality primary and secondary education.
SDG4.2 Ensure access to quality early childhood care and pre-primary education for all children.
SDG4.3 Ensure equal access to affordable, quality technical, vocational, and tertiary education, including university.
SDG4.4 Increase the number of youth and adults with skills for employment, decent work, and entrepreneurship.
SDG4.5 Eliminate gender and other disparities in education and ensure equal access for vulnerable groups.
SDG4.6 Ensure all youth and most adults achieve literacy and numeracy.
SDG4.7 Ensure all learners gain knowledge and skills for sustainable development, human rights, and global citizenship.
SDG4.a Build and upgrade safe, inclusive, and effective learning environments for all.
SDG4.b Expand scholarships for developing countries to access higher and technical education.
SDG4.c Increase the supply of qualified teachers through international cooperation and training.
SDG5.1 End all forms of discrimination against women and girls everywhere.
SDG5.2 Eliminate all forms of violence against women and girls, including trafficking and sexual exploitation.
SDG5.3 Eliminate harmful practices such as child, early and forced marriage, and female genital mutilation.
SDG5.4 Recognize and value unpaid care and domestic work through services, social protection, and shared responsibility.
SDG5.5 Ensure women’s full participation and equal opportunities for leadership in political, economic, and public life.
SDG5.6 Ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health and reproductive rights.
SDG5.a Reform laws to ensure women’s equal rights to economic resources, property, finance, and natural resources.
SDG5.b Promote women’s empowerment through technology, especially information and communications technology.
SDG5.c Strengthen policies and legislation to promote gender equality and women’s empowerment at all levels.
SDG6.1 Achieve universal and equitable access to safe and affordable drinking water for all.
SDG6.2 Ensure sanitation and hygiene for all, with focus on women, girls, and vulnerable groups.
SDG6.3 Improve water quality by reducing pollution, halving untreated wastewater, and increasing recycling and safe reuse.
SDG6.4 Increase water-use efficiency and ensure sustainable freshwater supply to address water scarcity.
SDG6.5 Implement integrated water-resources management at all levels, including transboundary cooperation.
SDG6.6 Protect and restore water-related ecosystems such as wetlands, rivers, forests, and lakes.
SDG6.a Expand international cooperation and capacity-building for water and sanitation programs and technologies.
SDG6.b Strengthen community participation in water and sanitation management.
SDG7.1 Ensure universal access to affordable, reliable, and modern energy services.
SDG7.2 Substantially increase the share of renewable energy in the global energy mix.
SDG7.3 Double the global rate of improvement in energy efficiency.
SDG7.a Strengthen international cooperation for clean energy research, technology, and investment.
SDG7.b Expand infrastructure and upgrade technology to provide sustainable energy in developing countries.

Level 1: SDG8 - Decent Work and Economic Growth
Level 2: SDG8.1 Sustain per capita economic growth, aiming for at least 7% GDP growth annually in least developed countries.

Level 1: SDG8 - Decent Work and Economic Growth
Level 2: SDG8.2 Increase economic productivity through diversification, technological upgrading, and innovation.

Level 1: SDG8 - Decent Work and Economic Growth
Level 2: SDG8.3 Support decent work, entrepreneurship, and SME growth through inclusive policies and access to finance.

Level 1: SDG8 - Decent Work and Economic Growth
Level 2: SDG8.4 Improve global resource efficiency and decouple economic growth from environmental degradation.

Level 1: SDG8 - Decent Work and Economic Growth
Level 2: SDG8.5 Achieve full and productive employment and equal pay for all, including youth and persons with disabilities.

Level 1: SDG8 - Decent Work and Economic Growth
Level 2: SDG8.6 Reduce the share of youth not in employment, education, or training.

Level 1: SDG8 - Decent Work and Economic Growth
Level 2: SDG8.7 Eliminate forced labour, modern slavery, human trafficking, and all forms of child labour by 2025.

Level 1: SDG8 - Decent Work and Economic Growth
Level 2: SDG8.8 Protect labour rights and ensure safe, secure working environments for all workers, including migrants.

Level 1: SDG8 - Decent Work and Economic Growth
Level 2: SDG8.9 Promote sustainable tourism that creates jobs and supports local culture and products.

Level 1: SDG8 - Decent Work and Economic Growth
Level 2: SDG8.10 Strengthen financial institutions to expand access to banking, insurance, and financial services for all.

Level 1: SDG8 - Decent Work and Economic Growth
Level 2: SDG8.a Increase Aid for Trade support for developing countries, especially least developed ones.

Level 1: SDG8 - Decent Work and Economic Growth
Level 2: SDG8.b Develop and implement a global strategy for youth employment and the ILO Global Jobs Pact.
SDG9.1 Develop quality, reliable, sustainable, and resilient infrastructure with affordable access for all.
SDG9.2 Promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and increase industry’s share of employment and GDP.
SDG9.3 Improve access for small enterprises to finance and integrate them into value chains and markets.
SDG9.4 Upgrade infrastructure and industries to increase resource efficiency and adopt clean technologies.
SDG9.5 Enhance scientific research and innovation, and increase R&D workers and spending, especially in developing countries.
SDG9.a Support sustainable infrastructure development in developing countries through financial and technical assistance.
SDG9.b Promote technology development and innovation in developing countries to support industrial diversification.
SDG9.c Expand access to information and communications technology and achieve universal, affordable Internet access.
SDG10.1 Achieve income growth for the bottom 40% of the population above the national average.
SDG10.2 Promote social, economic, and political inclusion of all people, regardless of background or status.
SDG10.3 Ensure equal opportunity and eliminate discriminatory laws, policies, and practices.
SDG10.4 Implement fiscal, wage, and social protection policies to reduce inequality.
SDG10.5 Strengthen regulation and oversight of global financial markets and institutions.
SDG10.6 Increase developing countries’ representation and voice in global economic and financial institutions.
SDG10.7 Facilitate safe, regular, and responsible migration through well-managed migration policies.
SDG10.a Implement special and differential treatment for developing countries in WTO agreements.
SDG10.b Increase aid, investment, and financial flows to countries most in need, especially least developed ones.
SDG10.c Reduce migrant remittance costs to below 3% and eliminate corridors costing over 5%.
SDG11.1 Ensure access for all to adequate, safe, and affordable housing and basic services, and upgrade slums.
SDG11.2 Provide safe, affordable, and sustainable transport systems for all, improving road safety and access for vulnerable groups.
SDG11.3 Enhance inclusive and sustainable urbanization and participatory settlement planning.
SDG11.4 Protect and safeguard the world’s cultural and natural heritage.
SDG11.5 Reduce deaths, losses, and damage from disasters, especially for the poor and vulnerable.
SDG11.6 Reduce the environmental impact of cities, focusing on air quality and waste management.
SDG11.7 Provide universal access to safe, inclusive, and accessible green and public spaces for all.
SDG11.a Strengthen links between urban, peri-urban, and rural areas through integrated development planning.
SDG11.b Increase cities adopting integrated, climate-resilient, and disaster risk–reduction policies.
SDG11.c Support least developed countries in constructing sustainable, resilient buildings using local materials.
SDG12.1 Implement the global framework for sustainable consumption and production, led by developed countries.
SDG12.2 Achieve sustainable management and efficient use of natural resources.
SDG12.3 Halve global per capita food waste and reduce food losses along production and supply chains.
SDG12.4 Ensure environmentally sound management of chemicals and waste and reduce their release to air, water, and soil.
SDG12.5 Substantially reduce waste generation through prevention, reduction, recycling, and reuse.
SDG12.6 Encourage companies to adopt sustainable practices and include sustainability information in their reporting.
SDG12.7 Promote sustainable public procurement in line with national priorities.
SDG12.8 Ensure universal awareness and education for sustainable development and lifestyles in harmony with nature.
SDG12.a Support developing countries in building scientific and technological capacity for sustainable consumption and production.
SDG12.b Develop tools to monitor sustainability impacts of tourism that supports jobs and local culture.
SDG12.c Phase out inefficient fossil fuel subsidies that encourage wasteful consumption while protecting the poor.
SDG13.1 Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters.
SDG13.2 Integrate climate change measures into national policies, strategies, and planning.
SDG13.3 Improve education and capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, and early warning.
SDG13.a Mobilize $100 billion annually for climate action and fully operationalize the Green Climate Fund.
SDG13.b Strengthen climate planning capacity in developing and small island states, with focus on women and local communities.
SDG14.1 Reduce marine pollution from land-based activities, including marine debris and nutrient pollution.
SDG14.2 Sustainably manage and protect marine and coastal ecosystems to prevent adverse impacts and restore ocean health.
SDG14.3 Minimize and address ocean acidification through enhanced scientific cooperation.
SDG14.4 Regulate harvesting, end overfishing and illegal practices, and restore fish stocks to sustainable levels.
SDG14.5 Conserve at least 10% of coastal and marine areas based on scientific information and legal frameworks.
SDG14.6 Eliminate harmful fisheries subsidies that promote overfishing, ensuring fair treatment for developing countries.
SDG14.7 Increase economic benefits for small island and least developed countries from sustainable marine resource use.
SDG14.a Expand scientific knowledge, research, and technology transfer to improve ocean health and support developing countries.
SDG14.b Ensure small-scale artisanal fishers have access to marine resources and markets.
SDG14.c Strengthen implementation of international law on oceans, including the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea.
SDG15.1 Protect and restore terrestrial and freshwater ecosystems, including forests and wetlands.
SDG15.2 Promote sustainable forest management, halt deforestation, and increase reforestation globally.
SDG15.3 Combat desertification and restore degraded land to achieve a land-degradation-neutral world.
SDG15.4 Conserve mountain ecosystems and biodiversity to sustain their essential benefits.
SDG15.5 Take urgent action to halt biodiversity loss and protect threatened species from extinction.
SDG15.6 Ensure fair and equitable sharing of benefits from genetic resources and promote access to them.
SDG15.7 End poaching and trafficking of protected species and curb illegal wildlife trade.
SDG15.8 Prevent and reduce impacts of invasive species on ecosystems and eradicate priority species.
SDG15.9 Integrate ecosystem and biodiversity values into national and local planning and accounting.
SDG15.a Mobilize financial resources to conserve and sustainably use biodiversity and ecosystems.
SDG15.b Increase funding and incentives for sustainable forest management, especially in developing countries.
SDG15.c Strengthen global support to combat poaching and wildlife trafficking through community engagement.

Level 1: SDG16 - Peace, Justice and Strong Institution
Level 2: SDG16.1 Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related deaths everywhere.

Level 1: SDG16 - Peace, Justice and Strong Institution
Level 2: SDG16.2 End abuse, exploitation, trafficking, and all forms of violence and torture against children.

Level 1: SDG16 - Peace, Justice and Strong Institution
Level 2: SDG16.3 Promote the rule of law and ensure equal access to justice for all.

Level 1: SDG16 - Peace, Justice and Strong Institution
Level 2: SDG16.4 Reduce illicit financial and arms flows, recover stolen assets, and combat organized crime.

Level 1: SDG16 - Peace, Justice and Strong Institution
Level 2: SDG16.5 Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all forms.

Level 1: SDG16 - Peace, Justice and Strong Institution
Level 2: SDG16.6 Develop effective, accountable, and transparent institutions at all levels.

Level 1: SDG16 - Peace, Justice and Strong Institution
Level 2: SDG16.7 Ensure inclusive, participatory, and representative decision-making at all levels.

Level 1: SDG16 - Peace, Justice and Strong Institution
Level 2: SDG16.8 Strengthen developing countries’ participation in global governance institutions.

Level 1: SDG16 - Peace, Justice and Strong Institution
Level 2: SDG16.9 Provide legal identity for all, including birth registration.

Level 1: SDG16 - Peace, Justice and Strong Institution
Level 2: SDG16.10 Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms.

Level 1: SDG16 - Peace, Justice and Strong Institution
Level 2: SDG16.a Strengthen institutions and build capacity to prevent violence and combat terrorism and crime.

Level 1: SDG16 - Peace, Justice and Strong Institution
Level 2: SDG16.b Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development.
SDG17.1 Strengthen domestic resource mobilization and tax capacity in developing countries through international support.
SDG17.2 Meet international official development assistance (ODA) commitments, including 0.7% of GNI for developing countries.
SDG17.3 Mobilize additional financial resources for developing countries from diverse sources.
SDG17.4 Support developing countries in achieving debt sustainability through financing, relief, and restructuring.
SDG17.5 Implement investment promotion regimes for least developed countries.
SDG17.6 Strengthen global cooperation and knowledge sharing on science, technology, and innovation.
SDG17.7 Promote development and transfer of environmentally sound technologies to developing countries on favorable terms.
SDG17.8 Operationalize the technology bank for least developed countries and enhance use of digital and ICT tools.
SDG17.9 Strengthen capacity-building support to developing countries through international cooperation.
SDG17.10 Promote an open, equitable, and rules-based multilateral trading system under the WTO.
SDG17.11 Increase developing countries’ exports and double the share of least developed countries in global trade.
SDG17.12 Ensure duty-free and quota-free market access for least developed countries with transparent rules of origin.
SDG17.13 Enhance global macroeconomic stability through policy coordination and coherence.
SDG17.14 Improve policy coherence for sustainable development.
SDG17.15 Respect national policy space and leadership for poverty eradication and sustainable development.
SDG17.16 Strengthen global and multi-stakeholder partnerships to mobilize knowledge, technology, and financial resources.
SDG17.17 Promote effective public, private, and civil society partnerships to support sustainable development.
SDG17.18 Increase data capacity in developing countries to produce timely, reliable, and disaggregated statistics.
SDG17.19 Develop broader measures of sustainable development and strengthen statistical capacity in developing countries.
